heaviest_rainfall.status: The heaviest total rainfall occurred on 04 January 2025, dropping 36.8mm of rain over the 37.2 hour storm duration with a maximum rate of 4.6mm per hour.

heaviest_rainrate.status: On 02 September 2025, the rain fell at an exceptional rate, peaking at 27.0mm per hour, the heaviest downpour recorded.  A total of 21.19mm fell over the 15.0 hour storm.

longest_rain.status: On 04 January 2025, the rain lasted for 37.2 hours, which is the longest time recorded by our database.  36.8mm accumulated and it fell at 4.6mm per hour at times.

most_lightning.status: Since 11 April 2025, the day with the most lightning strikes is 07 September 2025 when 23 were seen.

storm.status: Currently no stormy weather.  The most recent storm happened on 21 September 2025 and it lasted for 1 day.

top_10_dry.status: The longest dry period started on 24 April 2025 and lasted for 19 days.

top_10_rainy.status: The longest rainy period started on 30 November 2024 and lasted for 10 days.

cold_snaps.status: There is no cold snap at the moment.  This year has experienced 6 cold snaps, with an average of 3.7 per year.

extreme.status: The largest temperature gap recorded is 26.7°C (0.4 - 27.1°C) on 29 April 2025.

heatwaves.status: Currently, the weather is stable with no heatwaves in progress.  So far, 6 heatwavess have been recorded this year.  The average yearly count is 1.9.

tropical.status: The last tropical night was 18 July 2025, there have been only 62 tropical nights since 1973.

average.status: The current average daily wind direction is southerly (187°), which differs from the daily average south-westerly (233.0°) by approximately 46.0 degrees.    In the UK, a southerly wind usually brings milder, moist air from the Atlantic.

gusts.status: To date, the maximum wind gust recorded is 93.7 mph on 13 October 2012.

run.status: The largest wind run ever was on 21 October 2012 with a value of 1737 miles.

speed.status: The largest wind speed ever was on 13 October 2012 with a value of 93.7 mph.

top_10_windy.status: The longest windy period started on 11 October 2012 and lasted for 21 days.

summary.description:
Today, cooler for the inside temperature (down 1.7°C).

The past week and month had observable variation in dew point temperature (up 49.5°C), feels like temperature (up 53.6°C), outside temperature (up 51.0°C), and cloud levels (down 502 m) when compared to today.

cloud levels.description:
Today’s average cloud levels is 179.2m lower than yesterday, 592.7m higher than the past week, 502.2m higher than the past month.

The cloud levels yesterday fell between 1176m minimum and 4770m maximum, with an average of 2310m; weekly and monthly averages were marginally higher at 1716.6m and 1807.1m.
cloud levels.summary: The sky’s high clouds will permit plenty of sunshine.

summary.summary: Inside; a mild and comfortable temperature is anticipated. Outside; moderate and mild. Also, the atmosphere will feel parched and dry and winds will be practically absent. Showers, the sky’s high clouds will permit plenty of sunshine, and sunlight will be very intense and bright. High pressure will dominate, leading to stable weather.
